_header: With woeful heart and great mourning
Subjects: farewells, lovers’; lovers, absence/separation of; lovers, praise of beloved
_description: A description of his mistress, with ‘Farewell’ anaphora — seventy-eight lines in 6-line tail-rhyme stanzas (interlocking in stanzas 1-3)

BLHar541.First Lines: With wofull hert & gret mornyngIn gret distresse & no lykyng…
BLHar541.Last Lines: …Þat I may onys et I dyeSum of your plesure to fulfille
BLHar541.Note:
78 lines of 6-line tail-rhymed (interlocking in stanzas 1-3),
                    with a “Farewell” anaphora.
BLHar541.Editions:
Fehr,  Bernhard. 
             “Weitere Beiträge zur englischen Lyric des 15 und 16
                Jahrhunderts.” 
             Archiv für das Studium der neueren Sprachen und
                Literaturen
         107 (1901): 48-61: 53-5.
Kirke,  Henry. 
             The Reliquary
         9 (1868-69): 75-6.
Robbins,  Rossell Hope,
                        ed.  
             Secular Lyrics of the XIV and XV Centuries.
         2nd ed. Oxford: Clarendon, 1955: 120-2.
